strapiJob.title: Regional Director of Donor Relations (Central/Midwest)
strapiJob.location: Bentonville, AR or Remote - Central/Midwest Region
strapiJob.description:
Position: Regional Director of Donor Relations

Location: Central / Midwest Region of United States

Status: Full time

Reports to: Senior Director of Donor Relations

Remote work available. Preference for candidates living within the states of Arkansas, Georgia, Illinois, Michigan, Ohio, Tennessee, and Texas.

Position Overview

The Regional Director of Donor Relations will serve a portfolio of qualified donors. The position will be responsible for donor research, cultivation, solicitation, stewardship, retention, and will ensure that donors are invited to participate and engage in the work and outreach of Lifewater International.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Manage relationships from varied accounts that represent individuals, churches, businesses, and foundations to qualify, cultivate, solicit, and steward these relationships through excellent 12-month planning and intentional outreach
  • Develop and cultivate major donors and President’s Circle donors based on yearly goals
  • Identify major gift referral prospects by executing a robust referral strategy with established partners
  • Draft major donor gift proposals and solicit major gifts from individuals, churches, corporate partners, and foundations
  • Identify, cultivate, solicit, and steward donors who have announced a commitment to planned giving
  • Recruit, train, and support key influencers who assist in advancement efforts
  • Steward and acknowledge donor gifts in a timely and personally appropriate manner, ensuring that donors feel appreciated and understand the significance of their gifts and partnership
  • Mobilize and accompany donors to visit Lifewater programs in Africa or Asia
  • Actively contribute to development strategies and Development team initiatives, making recommendations related to donor care and program strategies
  • Facilitate meetings with high-impact donors with Lifewater’s CEO and Sr. Leadership
  • Perform all related administrative duties including but not limited to ensuring that records/contacts on the database are maintained accurately and continuously entered and all financial and administrative reports are submitted in a timely manner
  • Other duties as assigned

Work Experience and Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • Adherence to Lifewater’s statement of faith
  • Passion for Lifewater’s mission of serving vulnerable communities and children
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience from an accredited institution
  • 5+ year in a sales or nonprofit fundraising role
  • Excellent writing and verbal skills
  • Thrive in a fast-paced, ever-changing, and fun environment
  • Demonstrate patience yet persistence in donor cultivation
  • Ability to persevere through challenges in the midst of rejections
  • Travel 12-24 times per year within a multi-state territory to meet face to face with assigned donors. Annual International travel may also be required.
  • Legally eligible to work in the United States; no sponsorship will be provided

 Preferred Qualifications

  • Proficiency with Salesforce, or a similar CRM donor database
  • Experience using project management software, such as Asana

 Physical Qualifications

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 25 pounds at times
